revised_title: Frequency-Dependent Sexual Selection: Models and Applications
tldr: This article discusses the concept of frequency-dependent sexual selection, where the preferred male phenotypes gain a sexual advantage when they are rarer in the population. The authors analyze three models of partial preference, including the O'Donald and Charlesworth encounter models, and compare their frequency-dependent relations. They also explore the implications of frequency-dependent expression of female preference and its impact on male sexual advantage.
